intro: Opulaster intermedius, commonly known as the intermediate opulaster, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, pentagonal flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are typically ovate with serrated edges, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Opulaster intermedius is often found in tropical and subtropical environments, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
